alert.note: Alert for Chesapeake; Isle of Wight; James City; Norfolk, Portsmouth; Suffolk; Surry (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued December 17 at 12:00PM EST until December 18 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM THIS EVENING TO 7 AM EST MONDAY... * WHAT...Up to one foot of inundation above ground level expected in low-lying areas near shorelines and tidal waterways. * WHERE...Surry and Isle of Wight Counties...in addition to the Cities of Norfolk, Portsmouth, Suffolk, and Chesapeake. * WHEN...From 11 PM this evening to 7 AM EST Monday. * IMPACTS...Shallow flooding is expected in the most vulnerable locations near the waterfront and shoreline resulting in a low threat of property damage. Expect up to one foot of water above ground level in low lying, vulnerable areas. Some roads and low lying property including parking lots, parks and lawns near the waterfront will experience shallow flooding. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. JAMES RIVER AT SCOTLAND/JAMESTOWN VA MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 4.0 FT, MODERATE 4.5 FT, MAJOR 5.0 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 1.8 FT, MODERATE 2.3 FT, MAJOR 2.8 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 17/03 AM 2.1 -0.1 0.5 1 NONE 17/03 PM 3.4 1.2 1.3 1 NONE 18/03 AM 4.3 2.1 2.7 1 MINOR 18/03 PM 2.8 0.6 0.9 1 NONE 19/05 AM 1.9 -0.3 0.1 1 NONE 19/05 PM 1.5 -0.7 -0.3 1 NONE SEWELLS POINT VA MLLW CATEGORIES - info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.
